modules.define: C is a general-purpose programming language created by Dennis Ritchie at the Bell Laboratories in 1972.It is a very popular language, despite being old.C is strongly associated with UNIX, as it was developed to write the UNIX operating system.
#include <stdio.h> is a header file library that lets us work with input and output functions, such as printf() (used in line 4). Header files add functionality to C programs.
To output values or print text in C, you can use the printf() function:
Single-line comments start with two forward slashes (//).
Variables are three types- int, flot, char.
C divides the operators into the following groups: 01.Arithmetic operators 02.Assignment operators 03.Comparison operators 04.Logical operators 05.Bitwise operators.
